meanings.definition: Midrashoth - plural form of midrash, a Jewish commentary or interpretation of biblical texts
meanings.sent1: The students studied the midrashoth to gain a deeper understanding of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi shared insightful midrashoth during the Torah study session.
meanings.sent3: The midrashoth made the biblical stories come alive with new meanings.
meanings.sent4: Her midrashoth on the creation story shed light on its symbolism.
meanings.sent5: The midrashoth added layers of wisdom to the ancient texts.

meanings.definition: Midrashoth - a collection of rabbinic writings interpreting the Hebrew Scriptures
meanings.sent1: The library contained a vast collection of midrashoth from different rabbis.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to the midrashoth to understand the historical context of the Scriptures.
meanings.sent3: Reading the midrashoth felt like uncovering hidden treasures in the Scriptures.
meanings.sent4: His teachings were like modern midrashoth, offering new perspectives on old stories.
meanings.sent5: The midrashoth served as a bridge between ancient texts and contemporary understanding.
